Header: Udaya R. Seneviratne assumes office as the President’s Secretary
Content: Udaya R. Seneviratne has assumed duties as the new Secretary to the President.The President’s Media Division said the new Secretary assumed duties at the Presidential Secretariat. Udaya R. Seneviratne is a Senior State administration officer. The appointment was made following the resignation of the former Secretary to the President Austin Fernando over personal reasons. Earlier he had served as the Permanent Secretary to the Ministries of Sports, Highways and Investment Promotion, Productive Promotion and Environment and Mahaweli Development. He had also served as the Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Deputy Secretary to the Ministry of Finance and Planning. Udaya R. Seneviratne also played a key role in the establishment of the Polgolla Cooperative Development Institute. He has also played a key role in many mega projects during his term of office.
